summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 20, 2019, discussing coordination among FBI personnel regarding victim assistance and updates for the ongoing Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It highlights the case's sensitivity and high-level oversight.

persons.name: MS Victim Specialist
persons.context: The sender of the main email, coordinating victim assistance and requesting updates from other FBI personnel for the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI Internal Coordination on Epstein Victims
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discussing victim assistance, service referrals, and the need for weekly updates due to the sensitivity and high-level oversight of the ongoing Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The Epstein case was an active, open investigation as of September 20, 2019.
The case was highly sensitive, with weekly updates being requested by FBI Executive Management.
FBI Victim Specialists were coordinating victim assistance, counseling, and service referrals.
The email indicates communication between FBI field offices (New York, Phoenix, and potentially LA) regarding the case.
